actor_awards.notes: Skelton won the Golden Globe for Best TV Show in 1959. He received the Governor's Award from the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences in 1986. He has two stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

filmography.title: A Southern Yankee
filmography.role_description: A clumsy bellboy in 1865 St. Louis who acts as a spy for the Union, accidentally becoming a hero despite his ineptitude.
filmography.plot: A bellboy poses as a Confederate spy to steal battle plans for the Union, leading to a series of chaotic misadventures behind enemy lines.

filmography.title: The Fuller Brush Man
filmography.role_description: A hapless street cleaner who tries to succeed as a door-to-door salesman to impress his girlfriend but stumbles into a murder mystery.
filmography.plot: A newly hired salesman becomes the prime suspect in a murder case involving a 'crime sponge' and must clear his name while dodging the police.
filmography.awards: Writers Guild of America: Nominated – Best Written American Comedy

filmography.title: Whistling in the Dark
filmography.role_description: A radio sleuth known as 'The Fox' who is kidnapped by a cult and forced to devise a perfect murder or face death himself.
filmography.plot: A radio mystery writer is kidnapped by a cult leader who forces him to plan a murder, but he tries to use his radio broadcast to signal for help.

filmography.title: Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines
filmography.role_description: In the prologue, Skelton plays a prehistoric man who comically attempts the first flight in history, setting the tone for the aviation comedy.
filmography.plot: In 1910, a British newspaper tycoon offers a large cash prize to the first pilot who can fly across the English Channel.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Original Screenplay; BAFTA: Win – Best Costume Design

filmography.title: Three Little Words
filmography.role_description: A semi-biographical role as the famous songwriter and baseball fanatic Harry Ruby, starring opposite Fred Astaire.
filmography.plot: The biographical story of the successful Tin Pan Alley songwriting team of Bert Kalmar and Harry Ruby.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Fred Astaire); Oscar: Nominated – Best Musical Score

filmography.title: Ziegfeld Follies
filmography.role_description: A hilarious announcer in the 'When Television Comes' sketch, showcasing his mastery of physical comedy and pantomime.
filmography.plot: The spirit of Florenz Ziegfeld looks down from heaven and imagines a new Follies show featuring the greatest MGM talent of the era.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Musical Comedy

filmography.title: Whistling in Dixie
filmography.role_description: Skelton reprises his role as 'The Fox', this time traveling to the Deep South to solve a mystery involving Civil War gold.
filmography.plot: Radio detective Wally Benton travels to Georgia to help a friend but stumbles upon a hidden Confederate treasure and a killer.

filmography.title: Whistling in Brooklyn
filmography.role_description: The third film in the trilogy, where Wally is framed for murder and must catch the real killer while pitching in a Dodgers baseball game.
filmography.plot: Wally Benton tries to clear his name of a murder charge while disguised as a bearded baseball player for the Brooklyn Dodgers.

filmography.title: Bathing Beauty
filmography.role_description: A songwriter who enrolls in a women's college to win back his swimming instructor wife, leading to chaos on campus.
filmography.plot: A man tries to reconcile with his estranged fiancée by enrolling in the all-female college where she teaches.

filmography.title: Du Barry Was a Lady
filmography.role_description: A nightclub hat-check boy who drinks a drugged cocktail and dreams he is King Louis XV of France.
filmography.plot: A coatroom attendant wins the sweepstakes and dreams he is the King of France in this Technicolor musical comedy.

filmography.title: The Yellow Cab Man
filmography.role_description: An accident-prone inventor of unbreakable glass who becomes a cab driver and gets mixed up with crooks.
filmography.plot: An eccentric inventor drives a taxi to showcase his safety glass invention but becomes the target of a crooked lawyer.

filmography.title: Neptune's Daughter
filmography.role_description: A bumbling masseur at a swimsuit company who pretends to be a polo player to impress a woman.
filmography.plot: Mistaken identity leads to romance and comedy involving a swimsuit designer, a polo player, and a masseur.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('Baby, It's Cold Outside')

filmography.title: I Dood It
filmography.role_description: A valet who falls in love with a dancing star and accidentally disrupts a theatrical production while trying to help.
filmography.plot: A valet uses his life savings to court a Broadway star, leading to a marriage of convenience that turns into real love.

filmography.title: The Clown
filmography.role_description: A rare dramatic turn as a washed-up, alcoholic Ziegfeld comedian trying to make a comeback for the sake of his son.
filmography.plot: A once-famous clown ruins his career with drink, but his devoted young son tries to help him regain his self-respect.

filmography.title: Merton of the Movies
filmography.role_description: A small-town movie usher who goes to Hollywood dreaming of being a dramatic actor but finds fame as a comedian.
filmography.plot: A naive movie fan travels to Hollywood to become a serious dramatic actor but is unknowingly cast in comedies.

filmography.title: Watch the Birdie
filmography.role_description: A camera shop owner who tries to save his business by taking news photos, getting involved in a scandal.
filmography.plot: A camera shop owner trying to get out of debt accidentally photographs a plot to cheat a rich girl out of her inheritance.

filmography.title: Excuse My Dust
filmography.role_description: An inventor in 1895 who creates a 'horseless carriage' (automobile) much to the dismay of his town.
filmography.plot: An inventor in the 1890s faces ridicule when he tries to build a gasoline-powered automobile.

filmography.title: Texas Carnival
filmography.role_description: A carnival barker who is mistaken for a Texas millionaire after losing his money in a crooked game.
filmography.plot: A down-on-his-luck carnival barker and his partner are mistaken for wealthy cattle barons at a luxury hotel.

filmography.title: Lovely to Look At
filmography.role_description: An American producer who inherits half of a Parisian dress salon and tries to save it from bankruptcy.
filmography.plot: Three Broadway producers inherit a failing fashion house in Paris and try to turn it into a profitable musical revue.

filmography.title: The Show-Off
filmography.role_description: A brash, loud-mouthed braggart who bluffs his way into a family and causes endless trouble with his tall tales.
filmography.plot: A loudmouthed braggart marries a sensible girl, much to the dismay of her family, and nearly ruins them with his schemes.

filmography.title: Public Pigeon No. One
filmography.role_description: A naive lunch-counter attendant who is tricked into buying worthless stock and tries to get his money back from mobsters.
filmography.plot: A gullible man is conned by a gang of crooks but inadvertently helps the police capture them.

filmography.title: The Great Diamond Robbery
filmography.role_description: A diamond cutter's assistant who is persuaded by a gang of thieves to help them steal a massive diamond.
filmography.plot: A diamond cutter finds a huge diamond and is tricked by a family of crooks who want him to lead them to it.

filmography.title: Half a Hero
filmography.role_description: A writer who tries to navigate the perils of suburban life and home ownership to please his family.
filmography.plot: A magazine writer moves his family to the suburbs and struggles with the lifestyle changes and financial burdens.

filmography.title: Thousands Cheer
filmography.role_description: Skelton appears as himself in a comedy skit involving an ice cream shop, showcasing his classic routine.
filmography.plot: A musical revue designed to boost wartime morale, featuring a thin plot about a colonel's daughter and a private.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Cinematography, Best Art Direction, Best Music

filmography.title: Lady Be Good
filmography.role_description: A comedic supporting role as a waiter and friend to the main characters in this Gershwin musical.
filmography.plot: A husband and wife songwriting team split up and find success individually, but realize they are better together.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('The Last Time I Saw Paris')
